clues.text: Cable sports network that will pay $400 million to air 175 baseball games between 1990-94
During the 1989 Grammy Awards, Pepsi ran a commercial in this foreign language--w/o translation
Her largest audience watched her "Diet Show" on which she discussed losing 67 pounds
In February 1989 this New Jersey senator was seen playing basketball on "The Cosby Show"
This 1989 CBS western was the highest rated miniseries in 5 years

rounds.comments: (Alex: For those of you who like word games.)

clues.text: This czar wasn't just terrible, he was vain, too
This cowboy movie title character turned ashen when I asked him to come back
Ryan has a big ball of it in his bedroom
Wander over to England if you want to see this prince
It's the only kitchen appliance Rosetta knows how to use
At his death, Chiron, the wisest & most just centaur, became this constellation & Zodiac sign
Callisto was an Arcadian nymph who was changed into a bear; later she & her son became these 2 constellations
In the Trojan War Ajax grew frenzied & killed himself when this man's armor was given to Ulysses
Hera cursed this nymph by saying "You shall have the last word but no power to speak the first"
Helen of Troy was the sister of these twins
Alabama is the "Yellowhammer State", a yellowhammer being one of these
Some call it the "Prairie State", some the "Land of Lincoln"
This state's nickname consists of a verb & a pronoun
Take the nickname of West Virginia, add green to it & you have this nickname of Vermont
Leapin' wizards!  It's New Mexico's nickname
Abbreviated lea., it's a distance equal to about 3 statute miles
Spelled with a "u", it's a measure equal to 252 gallons; with an "o", 2,000 pounds
Names of various champagne bottles larger than a magnum are taken from this book
In the metric system, an "M" stands for the prefix "Mega-" & an "m" stands for this prefix
Weight system used in pharmacy in which 1 pound equals 12 ounces
It's the title of Charles Higham's bio of the wife of Edward VIII & was her title as well
In 1981 James G. Nourse hit the best seller list with "The Simple Solution To" this puzzle
Melvyn Bragg used this Welsh actor's diaries in reconstructing the story of his life
Published in the year of its bicentennial, "Citizens" is Simon Schama's story of this revolution
He's hit the best seller lists writing novels about horse racing like "The Edge" & "Hot Money"
In 1493 Columbus named this Virgin Island "Santa Cruz", since then its name has been Frenchified
Your money's no good at this resort chain's bars, but your string of beads will pay for a round of drinks
Hope & Crosby traveled the "road" to this South American resort city by stowing away on an ocean liner
In 1945 Roosevelt, Churchill & Stalin met at this site, now a favorite resort of Soviet citizens
This seaside resort on the English Channel became the "in" place in the 18th c., thanks to George IV
Although its name suggests that it had 5 of these, the Pentaceratops had just 3; 2 were merely enlarged cheekbones
Scientists believe that dinosaurs lived through 3 geologic periods: Triassic, Jurassic, then this next one
The name Psittacosaurus means this type of lizard; it had a strong beak like that on this present-day bird
High levels of this metal, at. #77, in rocks near dinosaur fossils led to the asteroid theory of their demise
Similar to an Apatosaurus, this 52'-tall herbivore whose name means "arm lizard" had longer forelegs than hindlegs
Alphabetically, the first new entry for 2005 is the name of this radical Islamic organization
Also listed is this 3-word chronic medical condition specific to some veterans of Operation Desert Storm
Webster's got down to business with this term for the buying & selling of goods & services over the Internet
Something's fishy with the addition of this fatty acid found in fish oil that's linked to low cholesterol & LDL levels
New wine words include syrah & this Australian equivalent
In the comics, this character's famous line is "I will gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today"
An act of Congress fixed this as the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November
In England these breakfast items are traditionally eaten on Shrove Tuesday
Tuesday is named for the warrior god Tiu, whose father was this other god
His bestseller "Tuesdays With Morrie" chronicled his weekly visits to his dying professor
The revenge of the 47 ronin, a 1703 incident in this country, is remembered there each December 14
In the 1st century Kanishka ruled a chunk of central Asia from what's now Peshawar in this country
Fingers were pointed at Syria when this ex-P.M. of Lebanon was killed in February 2005
In 1975 the Khmer Rouge came to power in Cambodia & the left-wing group with this Laotian name took over in Laos
These mercenaries from the Magar, Gurung & other Nepalese tribes defended the British Empire in WWs I & II
Despite playing only 28 games at first base in 1999, Rafael Palmeiro won this MLB defensive award
Known as "The Wizard", this Hall-of-Fame Cardinal set records for most assists & total chances accepted
Terry Sawchuk & Chico Resch wore blockers & catch gloves as stars in this sport
AKA "The Glove" for his defense, this guard got no love from the Lakers when they traded him to the Celtics in 2004
One of the 2 200-meter medalists who each wore a black glove on the Mexico City Olympic victory stand

rounds.text: His name means "The Glory of" a certain goddess, & he built shrines to that goddess
